intro: Eupatorium verbenaceum var. scaberrimum, commonly known as roughleaf boneset, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical features include opposite leaves with serrated edges and a distinctive, aromatic scent. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported antipyretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
